position: Ex-Analyst at Morgan Stanley || CFA Investment Foundations || Masters of Commerce from N.M college || Bachelors of Financial Market ||

experience.title: Investor Relations Executive
experience.description: – Involved in end to end execution for 7 Fundraise deals having innovative startups from Seed to Series A Stage and 2 M&A deals.– Assisted the team and introduced 10 new Investors for the Company from my self-originated network.Day to Day responsibilities included– Helping Clients in formulating their complete fundraise strategy which includes creating funding road map, refining the funding terms and marketing materials, identifying right investors, assisting clients in Investor meetings and negotiations– Preparation of Investors Sheet including with their Investment thesis, In-depth Analysis of Sector of Investment, Sharing Pitch deck, Arranging the Meeting between VC investors and Startup founders and Assisting in the conference calls of Investors and Startup Founder to understand more deeply about their Requirement.– Identifying prospective clients and further conducting due diligence on the basis of Investment Thesis, Sector of Choice and Ticket sizes.– Identifying and searching Investors on Daily basis and extended Network with 100+ Investors in the firm

experience.title: Concurrent Auditor
experience.description: -Evaluating the NPA ratios of bank on Monthly basis.-Evaluating ratios as require in Concurrent report of a bank.-Verifying the different reports that require before Loans passed legislation and documents of Accounts Openings in bank on monthly basis.-Analyzing bank balance sheet,Profit and Loss Account, Trial Balance.

projects: [{"title":"“Project E-Commerce”- Growth of E-Commerce in India","start_date":"Apr 2020","end_date":"May 2020","description":"Project E-Commerce”- Growth of E-Commerce in India: Surveyed 150 people on their opinions towards E-Commerce’s Impact on Indian People in the Master's of Commerce degree Project.– 5% Increase is Assumed to grow every Year in E-Commerce Sector in India."},{"title":"‘Project Investment Behavior’- A study on Investment Behavior of Women Investors","start_date":"Mar 2019","end_date":"Apr 2019","description":"‘Project Investment Behavior’- A study on Investment Behavior of Women Investors: Surveyed 100 Women for opinions towards Investment Plans in Masters of Commerce degree project.– 55% of Women Investors are Risk Averse and 35% of Women Investors are Risk Neutral and 10% of Women investors are Risk Loving."}]
